modules.description: Checks whether a specified substring consists entirely of zero bytes. Works directly on OCaml strings and a given length. Useful for validating null-padded fields in binary data formats or ensuring memory buffers are properly initialized.

This module provides functionality to verify if a substring is composed exclusively of zero bytes, operating directly on OCaml strings with a specified length. The primary operation checks whether a given segment of a string matches a null-padded pattern, which is useful for validating binary data structures or ensuring buffers are correctly initialized. For example, it can confirm that a 16-byte header field in a binary format contains only null bytes, or check that a memory buffer has been zeroed before use. Key inputs include the string, offset, and length, with a boolean result indicating all-zero status.
